channel.title: ExploreMusic with Alan Cross
channel.description: This is the official, free weekday podcast of the The ExploreMusic Radio show. Built on the foundations of Canada's two top music documentary programs, The Ongoing History of New Music and The Legends of Classic Rock, ExploreMusic combines the power and reach of radio with the unlimited potential of the Internet, connecting fans with new music, and with each other. This podcast features the latest music news, interviews with big stars and emerging artists, and much more. Visit us online at www.exploremusic.com
channel.itunes:author: ExploreMusicCasts
channel.itunes:keywords: perspective context recommendation discovery explore music alan cross music geek the list you gotta hear this rock music alternative music blog ongoing history

item.title: EM.0692.Wugazi
item.description: M.I.A. remembers Amy Winehouse, Billy talent survives Slayer, and singer/songwriter Joe Pug drops in for a song and chat.

item.title: AHI.61.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Adam & Ira are at it again...

item.title: EM.0691.Megadeth Is Ready for Heavy T.O.
item.description: Alan Cross speaks with Dave Mustaine of Megadeth about Heavy T.O. Also, The Permanent Bastards get signed, and Low Level Flight swing by for a chat.

item.title: EM.0690.Between The Buried And Morrison
item.description: Adam Morrison speaks with Between The Buried And Me, Sully catches up with Fishbone at Warped Tour, plus new music from Horace Pinker, and a free Nirvana covers album!

item.title: EM.0689.Buzzcocks At Sled Island
item.description: Sully catches up with Steve Diggle of the Buzzcocks while at the Sled Island Music Festival in Calgary. Also, we track down Rise Against at Edgefest, and brand new music from The Planet Smashers.

item.title: EM.0688.Horrible Shank Battles
item.description: Alan Cross speaks with UK band Viva Brother, new music from Junior Battles, and hear Brain Fallon's latest project, The Horrible Crowes.

item.title: EM.0687.Dropkicking The Stanley Cup
item.description: Sully catches up with Ken Casey of Dropkick Murphys while at Festival D'ete De Quebec...plus, Sean Rowe visits the office, plus some new music from Cavaliers.

item.title: EM.0686.Warped Part 2
item.description: Sully checks in with this year's Vans Warped Tour...including drop -ins with Simple Plan and MC Lars, plus Alan speaks with ...And You Will Know Us By The Trail Of Dead.

item.title: EM.0685.Warped Tones
item.description: Sullivan talks to Chino and Abe from the Deftones, creepiest coolest song of the day thus far and Vancouver singer songwriter Pennon Brae. Plus coverage of this year's Vans Warped Tour...starting with The Street Dogs

item.title: EM.0684.Fuken Eh
item.description: Sully explores Unearths latest music and Alan chats with hometown heroes Anvil.

item.title: EM.0683.Punk Troubador
item.description: We hear from I Break Horses, Woods and England's fastest rising star Frank Turner has a chat with Sullivan about his latest release

item.title: EM.0682.THE Boxer Rebels
item.description: Ira chats with Boxer Rebellion on their 3rd LP, A Daily Discovery from Dan Mangan and some interesting Coheed news.

item.title: AHI.60.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Adam vs. Ira

item.title: EM.0681.Play Ball!
item.description: What do you get when you mix rock with a bunch of baseball fanatics? It's called The Baseball Project. Plus, FM96's Dunner helps out with the show, and some RHCP news.

item.title: EM.0680.Run With The Angels
item.description: Ottawa's Jen Traplin returns to help out with the show, U2 does something super cool, and The Black Angels are here for a visit.

item.title: EM.0679.Festival D'Ete De Quebec
item.description: A preview of this year's insanely huge Festival D'Ete kicking off tomorrow in Quebec City. Plus Ottawa's Jen Traplin returns to help out with the show, and Kirk Hammet of Metallica talks dogs.

item.title: AHI.59.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Adam vs. Alan

item.title: EM.0678.Moby, Part 2
item.description: Ottawa's Jen Traplin helps out with the show today, plus part 2 of Alan's awesome conversation with Moby.

item.title: EM.0677.Senators and SCUM
item.description: Power97's Matt Cundill helps out on today's show, plus part 1 of Alan's in depth conversation about Moby and some Screaming Trees news.

item.title: EM.0676.Dance Dance Dance to the Radio
item.description: Paul Langois of the Tragically Hip talks solo record, Cuckoo Chaos is Adam's Daily Download and Dave Grohl's other other band.

item.title: EM.0675.Dark Disco
item.description: A visit from East Coast band SlowCoaster, news on Propaghandi's latest and Mississauga's Jojeto is today's Daily Discovery

item.title: EM.0674.The Sand Turtle Video
item.description: We meet Eatliz, a cool band from Tel Aviv...plus new free unreleased music from Mastodon, and don't worry, HMV is fine.

item.title: EM.0673.Alt Country Monday
item.description: The Old 97's are here...plus a veteran Canadian musician helps out with the Daily Discovery, and Jack White hooks up with another late night talk show host...

item.title: EM.0672.SCENE!
item.description: Metallica Corporate Gig, SCENE! Festival information and interview with Artist Life

item.title: AHI.58.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Issues of Adam

item.title: EM.0671.It's Warped Time Again
item.description: Vans Warped Tour, Revival of Nu Metal and the Coolest Song of the Day

item.title: EM.0670.Me vs Liam
item.description: A chat with Liam Gallagher, Sharon Jones on her Motown Vibes and The Coolest Song of the Day

item.title: EM.0669.Sled Island
item.description: A look at the Sled Island Arts and Music Festival in Calgary...lots of cool indie stuff happening their starting tomorrow. Also, a chat with the newly reconstituted Greenhornes, and the German hacker kid who discovered a whole new way to steal songs.

item.title: EM.0668.Pumping Up Kicks
item.description: A fast visit from Foster The People, a cool way to get lyrics to a song in real time, and find out who the biggest most influential rock star is in Pakistan.

item.title: EM.0667.One More From NXNE
item.description: One more time with what's going on at NXNE in Toronto. Plus, a quick visit with The Flatliners (Who will be at RockFest in Montebello, Quebec this weekend), and there's new Metallica on the way, and it's not what you would expect!
item.itunes:author: Explore Music

item.title: EM.0666.NXNE 2 (06/16/11)
item.description: A phone call to Bill Stevenson of legendary punk band, The Descendents. Plus, murder most foul...foiled! And mour North By Northeast Festival coverage continues in Toronto.

item.title: EM.0665.NXNE (06/15/11)
item.description: We get serious about covering the massive North By Northeast festival in Toronto, plus Ian Blurton of C'Mon swings by for a chat, and what do you get when you mix Radiohead, NIN, and Nirvana? An awesome free mash-up, that's what.

item.title: AHI.57.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Issues time with Adam!

item.title: EM.0664.Jonathan Davis, Part 2 (06/14/11)
item.description: The second half of a conversation with Jonathan Davis of KoRn, NXNE kicks off in Toronto, and what do you get when you mix Green Day with Tom Hanks?

item.title: EM.0663.Jonathan Davis, Part 1 (06/13/11)
item.description: Part 1 of Mike Sullivan's interview with KoRn frontman Jonathan Davis, plus a guy who has released 25 albums since 2006 and the hot new music website that no one can get into...

item.title: AHI.56.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Adam and Alan have another session

item.title: EM.0662.PS Whatever (06/10/11)
item.description: Punk rock and post hardcore from Title Fight, Morrissey changes the menu, and is Apple trying to kill off the iPod?

item.title: EM.0661.Panic! (06/09/11)
item.description: Brendan and Spencer form Panic! At The Disco make a visit, plus how to make outdoor concerts sound better using your phone, and MC Hammer's death wish...

item.title: EM.0660.Hope & Ruin (06/08/11)
item.description: A sit down and a very special live performance from The Trews. Plus, those goofy people from The Westboro Baptist Church are going after emo this time, and a chance to win som rare coloured viynl from The Creepshow!

item.title: EM.0659.The God Particle (06/07/11)
item.description: Sam roberts discusses the search for the elusive God particle, Star Trek, and his new album Collider. Plus new RHCP's is on the way, and Radiohead gets remixed.

item.title: EM.0658.Not So Far Down the Crazy River (06/06/11)
item.description: Robbie Robertson, he of The Band, speaks to Jeff Woods about his new solo album, a free download from the guy who helped Kurt Cobain buy THE shotgun, and today's the day Apple does something with music in the cloud...what will it be?

item.title: AHI.55.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Adam has an announcement...

item.title: EM.0657.Metal Rush (03/06/11)
item.description: Canadian thrash legends Sacrifice are here and show us how you can turn Rush into heavy metal. Fat Mike's Las Vegas punk rock hotel, and the funny looking hitchhiker...

item.title: EM.0656.Unspeakable (02/06/11)
item.description: Supergroup metal from The Damned Things, Pearl Jam's new album, and four utterly goofy music news stories...

item.title: EM.0655.The Man With No Pancreas
item.description: Ex-gunner, sometimes Velvet Revolver, and loaded guy, Duff McKagan. Plus an interesting idea on how to release an album and there's new music from Coldplay coming this week.

item.title: EM.0654.The Tall One
item.description: What do you get when you mix Sonic Youth with Beck? Alan will show you...it's good. A special live performance from Said The Whale, and imagine this: Trent Zeppelin...seriously.

item.title: EM.0653.There's A Riot Going On
item.description: Free music from Iron Maiden, Atari Teenage Riot return, and the godfather of hip hop has died.

item.title: AHI.54.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Ira tackles Adam

item.title: EM.0651.Live from London
item.description: The Mahones celebrate 20 years of Irish-Canadian punk rock, a musical about the worst record in the world, and the ExploreMusic App is finally here...

item.title: EM.0650.Stuck In Paris
item.description: Bombay Bicycle Club are her for a chat and performance, Alan visits Jim Morrison of The Doors-sort of...and yes, he's still dead. And yes, U2 is gonna piss off the faithful tonight.

item.title: EM.0649.Live from Paris
item.description: A performance from a great Irish singer-songwriter named James Vincent McMorrow. Plus, Mexico gets tough on drug music, and Slipknot's Corey Taylor gets a gig at Oxford University. Also, something cool for all the Beastie Boys fans out there.

item.title: AHI.53.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Adam & Alan chat

item.title: EM.0648.A Real Live NY Doll
item.description: Alan calls a New York Doll, PouzzaFest kicks of in Montreal, Pearl Jam gets into the book publishing business, and it's the end of the world but most of us feel fine...

item.title: EM.0647.Sammy Hagar, Part 2
item.description: Part 2 of Jeff Woods' interview with Sammy Hagar. Also, putting vinyl mania in persepctive and an update on the new Soundgarden album project.

item.title: EM.0646.Prince William's Classmate
item.description: Part 1 of Jeff Woods' conversation with Sammy Hagar...the coolest song of the day comes from a classmate of Prince William, and 3 potential rock n' roll movies that show promise...

item.title: EM.0645.Stomp On This
item.description: My Morning Jacket returns, a special performance from Chris Velan, and washing your delicate undergarments with Rob Zombie.

item.title: EM.0644.Azerbaijan Wins! Azerbaijan Wins!
item.description: We meet an Irish band called Autumn Owls, the new global music power house is...Azerbaijan? And lots of free downloads!

item.title: AHI.52.Adam Has Issues
item.description: Alan returns to help Adam

item.title: EM.0643.Nikki Sixx Part 2
item.description: The second half of a talk with Motley Crue's Nikki Sixx...plus, courtney Love is back on twitter, Flogging Molly returns, and Myspace plays nice with Facebook.

item.title: EM.0642.Nikki Sixx Part 1
item.description: The first of a two-part converstaion with Nikki Sixx of Motley Crue ans Sixx:AM. Also, The Killers prepare to regroup, and hang on to your sanity, Alan actually gives props to Lady Gaga and her people...yup, seriously.
